markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

oregonlive.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The Oregonian, a daily newspaper based in Portland, Oregon, that covers news in the region and state.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Oregon Media Group, which includes The Oregonian and OregonLive.com, is owned by Advance Publications Inc., a privately held publisher of magazines and newspapers with holdings in cable television, operated by the Newhouse publishing family. The company’s nationwide holdings include Vanity Fair, Vogue and The New Yorker magazines, and newspapers including the Cleveland Plain-Dealer and The Star-Ledger in Newark, New Jersey. The site earns revenue through advertising.

Content

The OregonLive website primarily posts local news from the print edition of the Oregonian, along with content from journalists in the Oregon Media Group. The site occasionally posts articles from other news sources, such as the Washington Post. The Oregonian has a team of journalists focused on covering the area’s vulnerable communities, environmental issues, health, government, and criminal justice. In-depth reporting on these subjects appears in a  “watchdog” section on  the site.  

Credibility

The site makes it easy for readers to submit tips for corrections through an online portal. Corrections are posted on the relevant article, and the site publishes a daily roundup of all corrections.  Since 1999, the Oregonian has won six Pulitzer Prizes, including, most recently, in 2014 for editorial writing, for its editorials about rising pension costs.   

Transparency

The site’s articles are clearly labeled with authors’ names and newspaper affiliation. Mail and phone information is provided for the entire reporting and management team. Sponsored content on the site is clearly marked. The site’s ownership is easily accessible.

History

The Oregonian traces its history to December 1850, when the first issue of the Weekly Oregonian was published. It is the oldest newspaper in continuous production on the West Coast in the U.S. The domain name oregonlive.com was registered in 1996.

Written by:
Lillian Childress

Edited by:
Amy Westfeldt Eric Effron
